docs.snippet: The amount of  traffic from Google to other  sites, called downstream traffic, is lead by the computer category, but people are using search to find medical information and news, too. Travel is low in the ranking because users log on directly on t...
docs.lead_paragraph: The amount of traffic from Google to other sites, called downstream traffic, is lead by the computer category, but people are using search to find medical information and news, too. Travel is low in the ranking because users log on directly on to travel sites. The breakdown of downstream traffic is roughly the same for Google and its competitors. But, according to Hitwise, Google had 64 percent of all search traffic in August, compared with 23 percent for Yahoo; 8 percent for MSN Search; 3 percent for Ask.com; and less than 2 percent for the other 48 search engines combined. SHELLY FREIERMAN

docs.snippet: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day on Monday about privacy issues raised by Google's purchase of Jaiku, a Finnish company whose technology can extract consumer behavior data from cellphones, misattributed a quotation. It was C...
docs.lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day on Monday about privacy issues raised by Google's purchase of Jaiku, a Finnish company whose technology can extract consumer behavior data from cellphones, misattributed a quotation. It was Chris Messina, founder of the consulting firm Citizen Agency -- not Petteri Koponen, a co-founder of Jaiku -- who wrote in an e-mail message, ''To date, many people still maintain their illusion of privacy.''

headline.main: Alibaba Said to Raise $1.5 Billion in I.P.O.

docs.abstract: E-commerce portal Alibaba.com, one of China's fastest-growing technology companies, hit its goal of raising $1.5 billion in the biggest Internet initial public offering since Google, according to press reports. The company, the largest trading Web site for companies in China, sold 858.9 million shares, or a 17 percent stake, at 13.50 Hong Kong dollars each [...]

docs.snippet: With a market value of $217 billion, Google is now worth more than all but four companies in the United States....

headline.main: Bye Bye Pampers: Google Is Fifth Most Valuable Company

docs.abstract: With a market value of $217 billion, Google is now worth more than all but four companies in the United States.

docs.snippet: People searching Google are suddenly focused on a single subject: Halloween....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google's usually eclectic ranking of most-searched words has suddenly focused on a single subject: Halloween. While spooky search terms are all over the top 100, they are especially concentrated in the top 10, where only Karen Hughes, who just announced plans to resign from the State Department, has broken through at number 9.

headline.main: What Day Is It Again?

docs.abstract: People searching Google are suddenly focused on a single subject: Halloween.

docs.snippet: The ickiest test on this site....
docs.lead_paragraph: Forget haunted houses and horror movies. For a real fright, look no further than your own body. Take our health quiz to find out how much you know about things biological, scatological and illogical. Check your answers at the bottom of the page. (And no cheating with Google!)

headline.main: The Well Quiz: Things That Make You Go 'Eww'

docs.abstract: The ickiest test on this site.

docs.lead_paragraph: A week after losing out to Microsoft in a bid to invest in Facebook, Google is hitting back.

headline.main: Google and Friends to Gang Up on Facebook

docs.abstract: A week after losing out to Microsoft in a bid to invest in Facebook, Google is hitting back. The Internet search giant and some of the Web's leading social networks on Thursday plan to begin introducing a common set of standards to allow software developers to write programs for Google's social network, Orkut, as well [...]

docs.snippet: An alliance of companies led by Google plans to roll out a common set of standards to allow developers to write programs for Google’s Orkut and other social networking Web sites....
docs.lead_paragraph: An alliance of companies led by Google plans to roll out a common set of standards to allow developers to write programs for Google’s Orkut and other social networking Web sites.

headline.main: Google and Friends to Gang Up on Facebook
headline.print_headline: For Google, A New Shot At Facebook
